intro: Clematis parvifrons, commonly known as the small-leaved clematis, is a deciduous vine native to the eastern United States. It features slender, woody stems that climb using hooked tendrils, often reaching lengths of several meters. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white to pale blue, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its compound leaves are pinnately arranged with small, ovate leaflets. Clematis parvifrons thrives in partial to full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
